title: Discharge Summary Requirements
text: Discharge summaries must be completed within 48 hours of discharge. Include admission diagnosis, key hospital course, procedures, medication changes, follow up plan, and pending results. Avoid speculative statements and cite source documents when summarizing.

title: Medication Reconciliation
text: Medication reconciliation is required at admission, transfer, and discharge. Confirm home meds, document changes with rationale, and reconcile allergies. Use approved medication sources only.

title: Prior Authorization Workflow
text: Prior authorization requests must include payer plan, CPT/HCPCS code, clinical justification, and ordering provider NPI. SLA target is 3 business days. Escalate urgent cases to utilization review.

title: ICD-10 Coding Guidance
text: Assign ICD-10 codes based on provider documentation. Do not infer diagnoses. Use laterality and encounter-specific codes when documented. Query the provider for unclear documentation.

title: Radiology Turnaround
text: Routine radiology reports should be finalized within 24 hours; STAT within 1 hour. Notify ordering provider for critical results per critical value policy.

title: HIPAA Minimum Necessary
text: Access, use, and disclosure of PHI must be limited to the minimum necessary for the task. De-identify data for training and analytics when possible.
